arm_group.description: Patients having cataract will undergo surgery by using Aurosleek blades

brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the safety and surgical effectiveness of surgical blades (Aurosleek) made by
      Aurolab.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Surgical Performance Study of Aurosleek Surgical Blades

detailed_description.textblock:
Cataract till today remains the most common yet treatable cause of blindness accounting for
      more than 50% of blindness and visual impairment in the developing world. One of the most
      important features of a blade for cataract surgery is its predictable and repeatable
      behavior. The surgeon repeatedly and reliably needs to create similar tunnels of the proper
      length. Aurolab is producing surgical blades (Aurosleek) intended for making incision in
      cataract surgeries.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Senile cataract

          -  Willing to give written informed consent

          -  Ability to follow study instructions and likely to complete required visits.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Intraoperative complication including Posterior Capsular Rent and Zonular dialysis

          -  Traumatic cataract

          -  Uveitis and Complicated cataract

          -  One eyed patients

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing cataract surgery would be included in this observational study

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Open Label, Observational Study To Evaluate The Safety And Surgical Performance Of Surgical Blade (Aurosleek) In Cataract Patients

primary_outcome.description:
Assessment of physio-clinical characteristics of surgical blade such as handling of the blade, sharpness and smoothness of blade.
Handling of the surgical blade will be assessed in grades of difficult to handle,easy to handle and very easy to handle intraoperatively. Sharpness and smoothness of the blade will be rated as poor or optimum while performing cataract surgery.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
The frequency and occurrence of post operative complications such as rhexis tear,  posterior capsular rupture, severe corneal edema, severe iritis and anterior vitrectomy.
Post operative complications occurrence due to surgical blade will be observed and graded as none or mild or moderate or severe at surgery and post operative 30 days.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
